blocks.title: Operators
blocks.description: C# provides various operators to perform operations on values.

blocks.title: Arithmetic Operators Example
blocks.description: Examples for each operator to show the functionalities.
blocks.code:
int addition = 10 + 2; // 12
int subtraction = 10 - 2; // 8
int multiplication = 10 * 2; // 20
int division = 10 / 2; // 5
int modulus = 10 % 3;   // 1
Console.WriteLine(addition + " " + subtraction + " " + multiplication + " " + division + " " + modulus);

blocks.title: Assignment Operators Example
blocks.description: Shows different ways to assign values to variables.
blocks.code:
int a = 10; 
a += 5;   // a = a + 5;   a is now 15
a -= 3;   // a = a - 3;   a is now 12
a *= 2;   // a = a * 2;   a is now 24
a /= 4;   // a = a / 4;   a is now 6
a %= 5;   // a = a % 5;   a is now 1
Console.WriteLine(a); // Output: 1

blocks.title: Comparison Operators Example
blocks.description: Examples to compare the variables values
blocks.code:
int x = 5;
int y = 5;

Console.WriteLine(x == y);  // true (equality)
Console.WriteLine(x != y);  // false (inequality)
Console.WriteLine(x > 3);   // true
Console.WriteLine(x < 10);  // true
Console.WriteLine(x >= 5);  // true
Console.WriteLine(x <= 5);  // true
